discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
B. from the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app
Work orders can be created directly from the mobile app used by field service technicians to manage their work.

D. from a case record
Work orders can be automatically created from a case record, which is useful when service is needed in response to a customer issue or incident.

E. from an agreement
Work orders can be created from an agreement, which helps ensure that services are delivered according to the terms of the contract or service level agreement (SLA).
Why can't it be from a Purchase Order ?

comments.content:
Because in Dynamics you don't have a Purchase Order entity, you only have Order, hence if your entire infrastructure is based on Dynamics that will be part of an ERP and not directly in CRM.
The given answer seems to be correct.

discussion.content:
for me, it would make more sense to set the sla field prior to creating the SLA as I regard create new sla and schedule a new workorder as "generating the data" - while the others are more about settings and customizations:

Enable SLA functionality for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service.
Add the SLA field to a work order form.
Create a new SLA applicable when work order Priority is Emergency
Schedule a work order to meet the SLA

but the other way round would not be forbidden nor impossible:
Enable SLA functionality for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service.
Create a new SLA applicable when work order Priority is Emergency
Add the SLA field to a work order form.
Schedule a work order to meet the SLA
